acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since its 72-hour EC50 = 35mg/L for algae (Scenedesmus) (IUCLID, 2000), the substance was classified into Category 3.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 values of 1685-2368 and 3135mg/kg (IUCLID, 2000), the substance was classified into "Not classified" (Category 5 in the United Nations classifications).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Since its rat LC50 is 1641 ppm/4h (6mg/L) (IUCLID, 2000) and its saturated vapour pressure is 15.2mg/L, the substance was classified into Category 3 for vapour.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 values of 1242-1597, 1803, 2000-2170, 2130, and 2340mg/kg (IUCLID, 2000), the substance was classified into "Not classified" (Category 5 in the United Nations classifications).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Although water drinking tests using female mice were documented, only the abstract is available, without details such as the number of animals tested (IUCLID, 2000). Thus, the data are insufficient for classification.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Its classification for acute toxicity is Category 3, it is rapidly degradable (BOD degradability: 60.5%, TOC: 97.9%, GC: 100% (Biodegradation and Bioconcentration of Existing Chemical Substances under the Chemical Substances Control Law, 1977)), and its potential for bioaccumulation is estimated to be low (log Kow = -0.94 (PHYSPROP database, 2008)). Thus, the substance was classified into "Not classified".

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Since its flash point is between 38degC (Ullmanns, ICSC) and 41degC (Chapman, NFPA), the substance was classified into Category 3.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative results obtained from in vivo tests using somatic cells (micronucleus tests) (IUCLID, 2000), the substance was classified into "Not classified".

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure in the molecule

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: The substance contains oxygen (but not fluorine or chlorine) which is chemically bonded only to carbon or hydrogen.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: In 3 animal tests conducted during gestational periods, no effects were observed other than decreased body weight gain (Teratogenic 12th, 2007; IUCLID, 2000). However, since its effects on reproductive functions of parental animals were not provided, classification is not possible.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since tests using rabbits revealed that the substance was highly irritating (IUCLID, 2000) and was skin corrosive, it was classified into Category 1.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Since GLP tests using rabbits concluded that the substance was corrosive (IUCLID, 2000), it was classified into Category 1.

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: In local lymph node tests using mice, scores of 0, 1.93, 2.13, and 14.50 were obtained at 0, 3, 10, and 30% (wt/vol), respectively. Since the score of 3 or above represents positive reactions (IUCLID, 2000), the substance was classified into Category 1.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In 13-week inhalation tests using rats, histopathological changes were seen in the respiratory organs at 76ppm (0.28mg/L) (IUCLID, 2000). Thus, the substance was classified into Category 2 (respiratory system).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
